medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Diarrhea began during a trip to Sri Lanka and continued upon return to the United States. It varied between semiformed and liquid, occurring hourly over 12 to 18 hours daily, but allowed for sleep through the night. Associated symptoms included nausea, nonbloody emesis, and a weight loss of 5.9 kg. There were no fevers or diaphoresis. Three weeks prior to the diarrhea, intermittent episodes of severe nonradiating epigastric pain developed, lasting for hours.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hyperlipidemia, transient ischemic attack (5 years earlier), traumatic subdural hematoma (6 years earlier), idiopathic erythrocytosis for more than 20 years.
medical_history.family_history: Father had coronary artery disease; sister had breast cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Drinks one to two glasses of wine per week, does not smoke or use recreational drugs, and is married.
